actor_awards.notes: Known for appearing in six Alfred Hitchcock films (more than any other actor except the director himself) and for his role as Alexander Waverly in The Man from U.N.C.L.E.

filmography.title: North by Northwest
filmography.role_description: The head of a shadowy government intelligence agency who manipulates the protagonist into helping them capture a spy.
filmography.plot: A New York City advertising executive is mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies and is pursued across the country.

filmography.title: Strangers on a Train
filmography.role_description: The father of the protagonist's love interest, a senator whose career could be jeopardized by the scandal.
filmography.plot: A psychopath forces a tennis star to agree to a theory of 'criss-cross' murders, where they trade victims to avoid suspicion.

filmography.title: Rebecca
filmography.role_description: The doctor whose secret file on the deceased wife provides the crucial twist that resolves the mystery.
filmography.plot: A self-conscious woman juggles adjusting to her new role as an aristocrat's wife and avoiding being intimidated by his first wife's spectral presence.

filmography.title: Spellbound
filmography.role_description: The retiring head of a mental institution who hides a dark secret regarding his successor.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist protects the identity of an amnesia patient accused of murder while attempting to recover his memory.

filmography.title: Wuthering Heights
filmography.role_description: The sour, Bible-thumping servant at Wuthering Heights who witnesses the tragic romance unfold.
filmography.plot: A foundling adopted by a wealthy family on the Yorkshire Moors grows up to fall in love with his foster sister, with tragic consequences.

filmography.title: Father of the Bride
filmography.role_description: The highly professional and somewhat overwhelming wedding caterer/organizer who adds to the father's stress.
filmography.plot: The father of a young woman deals with the emotional pain of her getting married, along with the financial and logistical chaos of the wedding.

filmography.title: The Bad and the Beautiful
filmography.role_description: A successful British film director who works with the ambitious producer protagonist.
filmography.plot: An unscrupulous movie producer uses an actress, a director, and a writer to achieve success.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Gloria Grahame)

filmography.title: Suspicion
filmography.role_description: The employer of the protagonist's husband, who fires him for embezzlement.
filmography.plot: A shy young heiress marries a charming gentleman, but soon begins to suspect he is planning to murder her.

filmography.title: The Paradine Case
filmography.role_description: The state prosecutor who goes head-to-head with Gregory Peck's defense attorney.
filmography.plot: A happily married London barrister falls in love with the accused poisoner he is defending.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Ethel Barrymore)

filmography.title: A Christmas Carol
filmography.role_description: The chain-laden ghost of Scrooge's former partner who warns him of his fate.
filmography.plot: An elderly miser learns the error of his ways on Christmas Eve after being visited by three spirits.

filmography.title: We're No Angels
filmography.role_description: A struggling shopkeeper who is aided by three escaped convicts hiding out in his home.
filmography.plot: Three escaped convicts from Devil's Island hide out in the home of a kindly but inept merchant and decide to help him out.

filmography.title: Tarantula
filmography.role_description: A scientist whose experiments with growth hormones inadvertently create a giant spider.
filmography.plot: A spider escapes from an isolated Arizona desert laboratory and grows to gigantic proportions, wreaking havoc on the local town.

filmography.title: The Parent Trap
filmography.role_description: The clergyman who officiates the wedding plans in this classic Disney family film.
filmography.plot: Two identical twin sisters, separated at birth by their parents' divorce, are reunited at summer camp and plan to bring their parents back together.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Sound, Best Film Editing (Film)

filmography.title: Captains Courageous
filmography.role_description: A crew member of the fishing schooner 'We're Here' in this adaptation of Rudyard Kipling's novel.
filmography.plot: A spoiled brat who falls off a steamship in the 1920s gets picked up by a fishing boat, where he's made to earn his keep.

filmography.title: The Desert Fox: The Story of Rommel
filmography.role_description: The German field marshal who interacts with Rommel regarding the defense of Europe.
filmography.plot: The story of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel, focusing on his military campaigns in North Africa and his disillusionment with Hitler.

filmography.title: The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex
filmography.role_description: A historical figure and advisor in the court of Queen Elizabeth I.
filmography.plot: Queen Elizabeth I has a turbulent affair with the Earl of Essex, a man who is both her lover and a threat to her throne.

filmography.title: The House on 92nd Street
filmography.role_description: A Nazi spy leader operating in New York City.
filmography.plot: The FBI investigates a ring of Nazi spies in New York City who are trying to steal atomic bomb secrets.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: The Swan
filmography.role_description: A servant in the royal household in this Grace Kelly romance.
filmography.plot: A princess is urged by her mother to marry a crown prince, but her heart belongs to the family tutor.

filmography.title: Young Bess
filmography.role_description: The educator and tutor to the young Elizabeth I.
filmography.plot: The story of the early life of Elizabeth I, from her childhood to her ascension to the throne.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Art Direction, Best Costume Design

filmography.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
filmography.role_description: One of the doctors attending to the invalid Elizabeth Barrett.
filmography.plot: The invalid poetess Elizabeth Barrett defies her tyrannical father to marry the dashing poet Robert Browning.

filmography.title: Tower of London
filmography.role_description: A nobleman who falls victim to the schemes of Richard III.
filmography.plot: Richard III eliminates those ahead of him in line for the throne with the help of his executioner.

filmography.title: Clive of India
filmography.role_description: A government official involved in the affairs of the British East India Company.
filmography.plot: A biographical film about Robert Clive, who secured India for the British Empire.

filmography.title: Sadie McKee
filmography.role_description: The family butler. Often cited as Carroll's first significant film role.
filmography.plot: A working-class girl navigates through three marriages to wealthy men.

filmography.title: To Trap a Spy
filmography.role_description: The head of U.N.C.L.E.[[4](https://www.google.com/url?sa=E&q=https%3A%2F%2Fvertexaisearch.cloud.google.com%2Fgrounding-api-redirect%2FAUZIYQEZqZqJ5V-CFDyOB9ZCDIb8mKiP9TBD2lOvKZcGSaEg5QWDtkAfCcCwJOYxwgZcsYJiL5Pu6BzB_aMvdM-fxFgIrBThVlG67F57eMcRVfP9s67MtKTbJ59z52f_xQ6H-fxWo-udhu93zE1R)] who recruits a housewife's former boyfriend to stop an assassination.
filmography.plot: The expanded film version of the 'Man from U.N.C.L.E.' pilot episode, introducing the spy duo Solo and Kuryakin.

filmography.title: The Prize
filmography.role_description: A Swedish official involved in the Nobel Prize ceremony proceedings.
filmography.plot: An American Nobel Prize winner stumbles upon a kidnapping plot involving another laureate in Stockholm.

filmography.title: Enchantment
filmography.role_description: The faithful family servant who observes the generational romantic conflicts.
filmography.plot: An elderly general advises his great-niece not to make the same romantic mistake he made in his youth.

filmography.title: Forever Amber
filmography.role_description: A character in this lavish historical drama about 17th-century England.
filmography.plot: A woman climbs the social ladder in 17th-century England, eventually becoming the mistress of King Charles II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Original Music Score
